prompt: <description>Part 1: Rectangular Prism Construct a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The sides are parallel and meet at right angles. The dimensions of the prism are 2 units by 3 units by 4 units. 1. Create a new coordinate system with the Euler Angles as (0.0, 0.0, -90.0) and Translation Vector as (0.0, 0.0, 0.0). 2. Draw a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system. 3. The sketch has one face (face\\_1) and four lines (line\\_1, line\\_2, line\\_3, line\\_4). * Line 1: Start Point (0.0, 0.0) and End Point (0.6532, 0.0) * Line 2: Start Point (0.6532, 0.0) and End Point (0.6532, 0.0768) * Line 3: Start Point (0.6532, 0.0768) and End Point (0.0, 0.0768) * Line 4: Start Point (0.0, 0.0768) and End Point (0.0, 0.0) 4. Close the loop. 5. Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.6532. 6. Transform the 2D sketch into 3D using the defined coordinate system. 7. Extrude the sketch along the Z-axis by 0.75 units. Part 2: Cylindrical Object with a Hole Construct a CAD model of a cylindrical object with a smaller cylindrical hole in the center, positioned in the upper right corner of the image. 1. Create a new coordinate system with the Euler Angles as (0.0, 0.0, 0.0) and Translation Vector as (0.1482, 0.0484, 0.0768). 2. Draw a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system. 3. The sketch has four faces (face\\_1, face\\_2, face\\_3, face\\_4) and each has a single circle (circle\\_1). * Face 1: Circle with Center (0.0181, 0.0181) and Radius 0.0181. * Face 2: Circle with Center (0.0181, 0.6351) and Radius 0.0181. * Face 3: Circle with Center (0.4264, 0.5383) and Radius 0.0181. * Face 4: Circle with Center (0.4355, 0.0786) and Radius 0.0181. 4. Close the loops. 5. Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.6532. 6. Transform the 2D sketch into 3D using the defined coordinate system. 7. Extrude the sketch along the negative Z-axis by 0.0384 units, which will cut material from the part 1. Kindly note that the final CAD shape consists of the above two parts.</description>
